meanings.definition: Concerned with beauty or the appreciation of beauty.
meanings.sent1: She has an esthetic taste in art, always choosing the most beautiful pieces.
meanings.sent2: The garden had an esthetic appeal, with colorful flowers and neatly trimmed bushes.
meanings.sent3: The esthetic design of the cake made it almost too pretty to eat.
meanings.sent4: Her esthetic sense was like a painter's brush, creating beauty in everything she touched.
meanings.sent5: The esthetic view from the mountaintop took her breath away.

meanings.definition: A set of principles underlying and guiding the work of a particular artist or artistic movement.
meanings.sent1: The artist followed the esthetic of minimalism, focusing on simplicity and clean lines.
meanings.sent2: The Renaissance esthetic valued realism and attention to detail.
meanings.sent3: The esthetic of the play was to make the audience laugh at the absurdity of everyday life.
meanings.sent4: His music had an esthetic that transported listeners to another world.
meanings.sent5: The esthetic of the fashion show was avant-garde and daring.
